sentences.english: One day he sees a beautiful bell at the top of a door.
sentences.chinese: 一天，他看見一戶人家的門頭有個很美麗的鈴鐺。

sentences.english: Father Fauvent, you will get another knee-cap with a bell.
sentences.chinese: 割爺，您再準備一副有鈴鐺的膝帶。

sentences.english: It was like the tinkling of a bell.
sentences.chinese: 好象是個受到振動的鈴鐺。

sentences.english: The corpuscle agent hardly sees the alarm belt cook.
sentences.chinese: 小單間的賣次很多見到鈴鐺帶子熔化。

sentences.english: Santa Claus suddenly remembered the elk hung bells around his neck.
sentences.chinese: 突然想起聖誕老公公的麋鹿脖子上掛着的鈴鐺。

sentences.english: One person in the family will ring abell and call everyone to come to the room.
sentences.chinese: 每家有一個人搖着鈴鐺叫所有人去屋裏看禮物。

sentences.english: Belling the cat Long ago, there was a big cat in the house.
sentences.chinese: 給貓戴鈴鐺很久以前，在一座房子裏住着一隻大貓。

sentences.english: Get yourself some mummers and a bucket.
When the white doves flew past, they struck the bells with their wings and made them tinkle.
sentences.chinese: 每當白鴿飛過，翅膀掠過鈴鐺，便叮鈴作響。
她的手鐲像鈴鐺一樣叮噹作響。

sentences.english: The tiled roof was of sea-green porcelain, and the jutting eaves were festooned with little bells.
sentences.chinese: 屋頂以海青色的瓷瓦鋪就，飛檐上則懸着小小的鈴鐺。
銀色的鈴鐺和扭曲的貝殼。

sentences.english: The  cell seller  seldom sees the bell belt  melt.
sentences.chinese: 小單間的賣主很少見到鈴鐺帶子融化。

sentences.english: Gremlin bells are his best sellers.
sentences.chinese: 小鬼鈴鐺是其中賣得最好的。

sentences.english: And they wait a few minutes more, before the bells jingle a warning.
sentences.chinese: 於是，又等了幾分鐘，然後，鈴鐺發出警告聲。

sentences.english: The leader of the young goats, who wears a small bell on his neck.
sentences.chinese: 喜羊羊是青青草原上的智多星，脖子上有個小鈴鐺。

definition: weight/pendant/same as 墜胡|坠胡[zhui4 hu2]/ballad singing accompanied by a 墜胡|坠胡[zhui4 hu2]
that/that kind of/that sort of/that type of
lit. mandarin ducks playing in the water/fig. to make love
